docs.title: Frozen Triple Berry Smoothie
docs.text: A single-serving smoothie with a thick, creamy texture that works well for breakfast or a quick snack.

docs.title: Quick facts
docs.text: Prep time 5 minutes Yield 1 serving Texture goal Thick, spoonable, and ice-cream-like

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
Ingredient Quantity Notes Frozen triple berry blend 80 g Strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, or your preferred mix. Frozen banana 1/2 banana Peel, chop, and freeze ahead of time for the best texture. Greek yogurt (plain) 1/2 cup (115 g) Use full-fat or 2% for maximum creaminess. Milk 1/4 to 1/2 cup Adjust based on desired thickness. Start with less and add more. Honey 1 tablespoon Optional sweetener.

Make-ahead prep

Portion the frozen fruit and banana into a freezer bag so it is ready to blend.

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Load the blender. Add the frozen berries, frozen banana, and Greek yogurt to the blender jar.
  2. Add liquid. Pour in 1/4 cup milk. Add honey if using.
  3. Blend slowly. Start on low speed, then increase to high until the mixture begins to move.
  4. Scrape and adjust. Stop the blender, scrape down the sides, and use a tamper if available.
  5. Dial in texture. Add the remaining milk one tablespoon at a time until the smoothie is thick but moves freely.
  6. Serve immediately. Pour into a glass or bowl and enjoy.

docs.title: Serving ideas
docs.text:
• Add a sprinkle of granola for crunch.
  • Top with extra berries or chia seeds.

docs.title: Garlic Sautéed Red Rice Bowl
docs.text: A warm, customizable bowl with a garlicky red rice base, roasted vegetables, and a protein of your choice, finished with a bright sauce.

docs.title: Equipment
docs.text:
• Small saucepan with lid
  • Medium skillet / sauté pan
  • Sheet pan
  • Mixing bowl + whisk
  • Cutting board + knife

docs.title: Base — Garlic Sautéed Red Rice
docs.text: Ingredient Amount Notes Red rice (dry) 70 g (~1/3 cup) Rinse until water runs mostly clear Water 120–130 ml Start at 125 ml; adjust if your rice runs firm Garlic 2 cloves Minced Button mushrooms 80 g Sliced Egg 1 large Optional but highly recommended Olive oil 1 tbsp For sautéing Fine sea salt 1/4 tsp Plus to taste Black pepper 1/4 tsp Plus to taste

docs.title: Timeline (cook in parallel)
docs.text:
Suggested flow

  • 0:00–0:05 Start rice + preheat oven
  • 0:05–0:15 Prep veg + prep protein
  • 0:15–0:30 Roast veg + cook protein + whisk sauce
  • 0:30–0:38 Sauté base rice + finalize
  • 0:38–0:40 Assemble + eat

docs.title: 1) Start the rice (hands-off simmer)
docs.text:
1. Rinse red rice in a fine sieve until the water runs mostly clear (30–60 sec).
  2. Add to saucepan: rinsed rice + 120–130 ml water + pinch of salt (optional).
  3. Bring to a gentle boil over medium-high heat (watch closely).
  4. Cover + reduce to low the moment it starts bubbling.
  5. Simmer 25–30 min (avoid opening the lid).
  6. Check doneness: grains should be tender with a pleasant chew.
  7. If still firm: add 1–2 tbsp hot water, cover, simmer 3–5 min more.
  8. Rest 5 min off heat, then fluff with a fork.

Rice texture control

If your red rice often turns out dry, start with 130 ml water. If it turns mushy, use 120 ml.

docs.title: 2) Preheat oven + prep the veg
docs.text:
1. Preheat oven: 200°C (400°F).
  2. Line a sheet pan (optional for easier cleanup).
  3. Broccoli bowl: add broccoli + 1 tsp oil + minced garlic + salt + pepper. Toss well.
  4. Mushroom bowl: add mushrooms + 1 tsp oil + salt + pepper. Toss well.
  5. Spread on pan in a single layer (don’t overcrowd; use 2 pans if needed).

docs.title: 3) Roast the veg (while rice cooks)
docs.text:
1. Roast 12–15 min, flipping once at the halfway mark.
  2. Stop when: broccoli has browned edges and mushrooms look glossy + browned.

Better browning

Keep broccoli pieces similar size and leave space between veg (steam = less browning).

docs.title: 4) Protein (pick your tab)
docs.text:
Roasted Chicken BreastGarlic Tiger PrawnsGrilled Salmon

Food safety

Chicken is cooked when the thickest part hits 74°C / 165°F.

  1. Pat dry chicken breast (better browning).
  2. Rub seasoning: oil + garlic + salt + pepper over all sides.
  3. Roast at 200°C for 15–18 min (timing depends on thickness).
  4. Rest 5 min (juicier), then slice.
  1. Pat dry prawns very well (prevents steaming).
  2. Season: salt + pepper.
  3. Heat pan over medium-high, add oil/butter.
  4. Garlic 10 seconds (fragrant, not browned).
  5. Cook prawns: ~1.5–2 min per side until pink and opaque.
  6. Optional: finish with a squeeze of lemon.

Avoid rubbery prawns

Pull them the moment they turn opaque—carryover heat finishes the job.

Doneness guide

Salmon is usually great at 52–57°C (medium to medium-well). For a fully cooked texture, go closer to 60–63°C.

  1. Pat dry salmon fillet (crispier exterior).
  2. Season: salt + pepper (and optional garlic).
  3. Preheat pan: medium-high, add oil/butter.
  4. Sear first side: place salmon presentation-side down (or skin-side down if skin-on). Cook 3–4 min until nicely browned.
  5. Flip: cook 2–4 min more (time depends on thickness) until flaky at the edges.
  6. Rest 2 min, then break into chunks.
  7. Optional: finish with lemon squeeze.

docs.title: 6) Sauce (pick 1)
docs.text:
Lemon SoyMiso Brown Sugar
  1. Add all ingredients to a bowl/jar.
  2. Whisk 30–60 sec until honey dissolves.
  3. Taste + adjust: more lemon for brightness, more soy for salt.
  1. Add all ingredients to a bowl.
  2. Whisk 30–60 sec until smooth (no miso lumps).
  3. Taste + adjust: more vinegar for tang, more sugar for sweetness.

Make it smoother

If miso clumps, add 1 tsp warm water, then whisk again.

docs.title: 7) Finish the base — garlic sautéed rice
docs.text:
1. Heat skillet over medium, add 1 tbsp olive oil.
  2. Garlic 10 seconds (just fragrant).
  3. Add mushrooms and sauté 2–3 min until softened and glossy.
  4. Push mushrooms aside to create a clear spot in the pan.
  5. Crack in egg, scramble 1–2 min until just set.
  6. Add cooked rice + measured salt + pepper.
  7. Stir-fry 2–3 min until hot, lightly glossy, and evenly mixed.
  8. Taste + adjust salt/pepper.

If your rice clumps

Add 1 tsp water and stir-fry another 30 sec to loosen.

docs.title: Assemble
docs.text:
1. Base: spoon garlic rice into a bowl.
  2. Veg: add roasted broccoli + roasted mushrooms.
  3. Add-in: corn / edamame / tomatoes (optional).
  4. Protein: top with chicken or prawns.
  5. Sauce: drizzle generously.
  6. Finish (optional): extra lemon squeeze, cracked pepper, chopped herbs.
